entry.title: Behind The Mask: John Stezaker's Surreal Assemblages
entry.content: In an exclusive extract from his new book, *John Stezaker: At the Edge of Pictures*, Yuval Etgar examines the development of the collage artist's technique, ahead of a major show of Stezaker's early work opening at Luxembourg & Co., London, at the end of the week

entry.title: The Realness: Dhanveer Singh Brar On Dean Blunt’s Black Avant-Garde
entry.content: In a new book for recently launched London-based small publisher The 87 Press, Goldsmiths lecturer Dhanveer Singh Brar analyses Babyfather’s album *“BBF” Hosted by DJ Escrow*

entry.title: Carl Craig & Moritz Von Oswald Reveal New Single, 'Attenuator'
entry.content: The two producers have each offered up their own take on the same track

entry.title: All Hell Broke Loose: David Fincher's Se7en And The Medieval Morality Play
entry.content: David Fincher's grisly neo-noir turns 25 this year, but its major influences go back much further than the film industry. Kristina Murkett explores the film's roots in the medieval morality play

entry.title: Corsica Studios Launches Fundraising Campaign
entry.content: The London club has Jamie xx on board for a fundraising event as it faces closure due to the COVID-19 pandemic

entry.title: Call Super To Release New Album, 'Every Mouth Teeth Missing'
entry.content: It's the Berlin-based DJ and producer's first release for NYC's Incienso label

entry.title: Southern Journey, Revisited: An Interview With Rob Curry And Tim Plester
entry.content: From the minds behind The Ballad of Shirley Collins comes a new journey into the sounds and history of the Southern States of the US. Neil Fox sits down with the filmmakers behind the docu-road movie hybrid

entry.title: Sufjan Stevens - The Ascension
entry.content: A collection of sci-fi torch songs and cyborg songs of praise, Sufjan Stevens latest is a densely packed package, finds Jeremy Allen

entry.title: A Third Of UK Musicians May Quit Due To Pandemic
entry.content: A poll was conducted amongst about 2000 of the Musicians' Union's members

entry.title: UK Music Industry Reacts To Government's Winter Economy Plan
entry.content: Under the Chancellor's new plans, the self-employed will only be entitled to government grants of 20% of their average monthly profits

entry.title: Actress Shares Double Single, 'Loveless / Angels Pharmacy'
entry.content: The two tracks feature on the UK producer's forthcoming album

entry.title: Oneohtrix Point Never Details New Radio-Inspired Album
entry.content: 'Magic Oneohtrix Point Never' is out on Warp Records next month

entry.title: Deftones - Ohms
entry.content: Deftones are back with a record of raw, concentrated Deftonage, finds Marc Burrows

entry.title: Tender Cyborg: Bid Farewell To The Flesh With Róisín Machine
entry.content: Róisín Murphy returns with an album of dancefloor utopias and more-than-human bodies, finds Diva Harris

entry.title: Moor Mother To Release New Album, 'Circuit City'
entry.content: It's out this Friday, and features the artist backed by members of her Chicago free jazz collective Irreversible Entanglements and the Circuit City Band

entry.title: PREMIERE: Lonesaw's 'Barbed Wire Church'
entry.content: Liverpool's Lonesaw share their debut single in the form of the harrowing 'Barbed Wire Church', watch the video below

entry.title: Morricone & Nicolai's Library Music Project To Be Reissued
entry.content: 103 compositions will be split across a 10xLP box set

entry.title: Human Nature: An Interview With Young Knives
entry.content: Young Knives' first LP in seven years sees the brothers Dartnall plumbing the depths of human darkness and emerging with by far their best record to date. They speak to Patrick Clarke about their bold new sound, and why they no longer consider themselves a 'band'

entry.title: Bristol's Colston Hall Renamed Bristol Beacon
entry.content: The venue had revealed earlier this year that it was deciding on a change of name to remove any association with slave trader Edward Colston

entry.title: The Centre Of Everything: John Frusciante's Favourite Electronic Music
entry.content: Electronic music isn't some casual fling for the Red Hot Chili Peppers guitarist. From synth-pop and ghetto house, to old-school UK rave and hardcore, it's long been a major preoccupation. As he prepares to release his thrilling, jungle-inspired new LP Maya, he guides Brian Coney through 13 indispensable titles from his collection
